summary: Ryan Reynolds' Detective Pikachu Tracking for Huge $75 Million Opening Weekend
title: Ryan Reynolds' Detective Pikachu Tracking for Huge $75 Million Opening Weekend
body:
Ryan Reynolds’ Detective Pikachu Tracking for Huge $75 Million Opening Weekend

Detective Pikachu starring Ryan Reynolds and Justice Smith is tracking to have an opening weekend debut over $75 million.

Box Office Promade the prediction citing the Pokémon brand describing it as “a cultural phenomenon around the globe, ranking among the top selling intellectual properties of the past two decades.” They also…

blog.name: sh5ehomebrew

blog.description: Welcome to my tumblr and I hope that you enjoy the Silent Hill Homebrew that I've created for you.

summary: I need to rave about Detective Pikachu a bit and if I post it on my main blog this won’t at all get noticed
title: I need to rave about Detective Pikachu a bit and if I post it on my main blog this won’t at all get noticed
body:
So… firstly, I would do a pokemon homebrew if that wasn’t already the thing that inspired me to do this Silent Hill homebrew.

But I need to talk about this movie for a moment.

So… they referenced Sweet Mother of Arceus, which means that they’ve actually done a fair bit of research considering how dug in Arceus is into the in-game lore. The Pokemon is rarely referenced in it’s generation and is referenced even less later on. So they at least consulted with fans of the franchise before going into this. Not to mention that Legendary Films (the company that made comic book movies a think with the Dark Knight Trilogy) actually hired Pokemon fans to do concept art for the movie and have been putting a ton of effort into making the models for each individual Pokemon.

Let’s talk about the Pokemon for a moment.

Mr Mime looks creepy, as he should due to seemingly being a minor antagonist. Gengar looks legitimately terrifying and seems like it might actually “steal the lives of those who become lost in mountains”, “steal its prey’s life force”, “ pay a visit to children who are naughty”, or kill you so that it can have a traveling companion.

Sorry… just needed to talk about this because I’m actually getting pretty excited for this. Even if it’s a bad movie I’ll probably still enjoy it.

Not to mention that Legendary Films (the company that made comic book movies a think with the Dark Knight Trilogy) actually hired Pokemon fans to do concept art for the movie and have been putting a ton of effort into making the models for each individual Pokemon.

blog.name: mandalawritersmart
blog.title: Reimagine!
blog.description: Promoting Positivity through your favorite characters!

body:
Pokemon Madness!!!

Hello, everyone! Sorry about the last few saturdays. I decided to put off “El Galan de Susie” for a while. To make up for it, here’s something for Pokemon fans to enjoy!😀

(Scene takes place in MARIO’s room in the Smash Dormitory. He is sipping a cup of tea on a soft chair.)

MARIO: Ah, such a peaceful day. The birds are-a chirping (tweeting birds), there’s no fights today; yessiree, it’s going to be an easy day-(sound of something crashing against the wall) Spoke too soon-a. (LUCARIO barges through the door, panicking.) I’m-a going to regret asking this, but what-a happened?

LUCARIO: (waving his hands up and down and jumping in a frantic manner) Help me! I’m being captured!

MARIO: (with one eyebrow up) By who? (Before LUCARIO could answer, a pokeball was flung just above MARIO, breaking the window.) What?!

(9-VOLT comes in. He’s wearing an unusual outfit today: he has on a suit made for business casual days, and his hair is neatly combed with no hat on.)

9-VOLT: (frusterated) I miss!

(BOWSER JR pops out, wearing a Greninja cap with his bandana colored dark blue, and instead of a mouth, there is a picture of a pokeball on it.)

BOWSER JR: (Pointing at 9-VOLT) No fair! I called dibs on Lucario!

9-VOLT: Nuh-uh! I saw him first!

MARIO: (getting up) What is going on here?

9-VOLT: (looks to MARIO and smiles in embarrassment) Oh, sorry, Mario. Bowser Jr and I were trying to capture Lucario.

MARIO: (shocked) Why were you trying to capture him?

BOWSER JR: Duh! That’s how you play Pokemon! Don’t you know anything, chump?

MARIO: (eyes wide open) Pokemon?! What the-how are- (grunts in frusteration) Can’t you-a go play somewhere else? You-are breaking windows!

BOWSER JR: (points to LUCARIO) Blame him. He’s the one who led us here in the first place.

LUCARIO: Because I was trying to get away from you! Besides, you can’t capture me! I already have a trainer.

9-VOLT: Yeah, but you’re in Smash, now. For example, Pikachu is usually owned by Ash, but since he’s an independent player, he’s free for capture. Same rule applies to you.

LUCARIO: (freaking out) Then why don’t you chase him instead?

BOWSER JR: We tried, but Samus already had dibs on him.

MARIO: Just get out of the-a dormitory!

BOWSER JR: (hands up in the air) Whoa, okay, chump. (To 9-VOLT) Come on, 9-Volt, let’s go find some other place to capture Pokemon. Someone where NO ONE will complain! (He and 9-VOLT leaves)

MARIO: (sitting back down on his chair) Mamma mia! What’s up with those kids?

LUCARIO: Tell me about it. (Rests on the arm of the chair) Maybe it’s all that March Madness stuff going to their heads.

MARIO: Or because of the warm weather.

(Suddenly, the ground started to shake, stumbling the two of them. After that, the sound of an engine is heard.)

LUCARIO: (alert) What is going on here?

MARIO: (horrified) I know that sound…

(He and LUCARIO take a look outside, where they see the Odyssey rising up from the ground. Along with it were 9-VOLT and BOWSER JR, whooping out in good fun.)

BOWSER JR: New Donk City or bust!

MARIO: (freaking out) How did they get control of that ship?!

(LUCARIO passes out. The Odyssey makes its departure, and the scene zooms way far into New Donk City, where there are kids getting into a new fad on Pokemon. There, it shows a view of children dressed up in various ways. In a building, there is KIRBY, dressed as a businesswoman, walking with a suitcase and a handful of pokeballs.)

KIRBY: I’m not only certified to do taxes, but I’m certified to do Pokemon Battles!

(Scene changes to where POPO and NANA are at, walking their Pichus on the sidewalk while checking their “Pokedexes”.)

POPO: Even though we are two…

NANA: We fight as one!

BOTH PICHUS: Pichu!

(Scene changes to the outside of City Hall, where WENDY was dressed fabulously for an occasion. By her side is Gardevoir, standing tall.)

WENDY: Having a connection with pokemon is the most fabulous approach!

(Scene changes to a shabby-made lab in the town center. There, PENNY is arranging her tools and textbooks while Eevee scurries around, making a big mess everywhere she goes.)

PENNY: Nobody said science was a clean job! (Ducks when Eevee knocks down some things from the table) The same goes with pokemon battles!

(Scene changes to the landing spot of the Odyssey for New Donk City, where it makes its landing. BOWSER JR and 9-VOLT hopped out from it.)

BOWSER JR: In the city, anything is possible. (Nudges 9-VOLT) Come on! Let’s go Pokemon training!

9-VOLT: (excited, jumping up) Yeah!

(Both exit the landing area. Off to the side was a mysterious figure in disguise. He faces towards the camera.)

MYSTERIOUS FIGURE: In case you’re confused, ever since the announcements of Pokemon Sword and Shield plus the Detective Pikachu movie, all the kids are hyped up, developing the lifestyle of pokemon trainers. 9-Volt and Bowser Jr want to be the very best. Well, (takes out pokeball, sneaky smile) let’s see…if they can try to beat me first! (Stage fades into black while an evil laugh emerges.)

(Who was that mysterious figure so determined to knock Bowser Jr and 9-Volt off of their goals? Find out when the story continues!)

LUCARIO: Oh, so now it’s a pokemon show based off Sm5sh? Come on, man!

reblog.comment:

NANA: We fight as one!

BOTH PICHUS: Pichu!

(Scene changes to the outside of City Hall, where WENDY was dressed fabulously for an occasion. By her side is Gardevoir, standing tall.)

WENDY: Having a connection with pokemon is the most fabulous approach!

(Scene changes to a shabby-made lab in the town center. There, PENNY is arranging her tools and textbooks while Eevee scurries around, making a big mess everywhere she goes.)

PENNY: Nobody said science was a clean job! (Ducks when Eevee knocks down some things from the table) The same goes with pokemon battles!

(Scene changes to the landing spot of the Odyssey for New Donk City, where it makes its landing. BOWSER JR and 9-VOLT hopped out from it.)

BOWSER JR: In the city, anything is possible. (Nudges 9-VOLT) Come on! Let’s go Pokemon training!

9-VOLT: (excited, jumping up) Yeah!

(Both exit the landing area. Off to the side was a mysterious figure in disguise. He faces towards the camera.)

MYSTERIOUS FIGURE: In case you’re confused, ever since the announcements of Pokemon Sword and Shield plus the Detective Pikachu movie, all the kids are hyped up, developing the lifestyle of pokemon trainers. 9-Volt and Bowser Jr want to be the very best. Well, (takes out pokeball, sneaky smile) let’s see…if they can try to beat me first! (Stage fades into black while an evil laugh emerges.)

(Who was that mysterious figure so determined to knock Bowser Jr and 9-Volt off of their goals? Find out when the story continues!)

LUCARIO: Oh, so now it’s a pokemon show based off Sm5sh? Come on, man!

trail.content_raw:
Pokemon Madness!!!

Hello, everyone! Sorry about the last few saturdays. I decided to put off “El Galan de Susie” for a while. To make up for it, here’s something for Pokemon fans to enjoy!😀

(Scene takes place in MARIO’s room in the Smash Dormitory. He is sipping a cup of tea on a soft chair.)

MARIO: Ah, such a peaceful day. The birds are-a chirping (tweeting birds), there’s no fights today; yessiree, it’s going to be an easy day-(sound of something crashing against the wall) Spoke too soon-a. (LUCARIO barges through the door, panicking.) I’m-a going to regret asking this, but what-a happened?

LUCARIO: (waving his hands up and down and jumping in a frantic manner) Help me! I’m being captured!

MARIO: (with one eyebrow up) By who? (Before LUCARIO could answer, a pokeball was flung just above MARIO, breaking the window.) What?!

(9-VOLT comes in. He’s wearing an unusual outfit today: he has on a suit made for business casual days, and his hair is neatly combed with no hat on.)

9-VOLT: (frusterated) I miss!

(BOWSER JR pops out, wearing a Greninja cap with his bandana colored dark blue, and instead of a mouth, there is a picture of a pokeball on it.)

BOWSER JR: (Pointing at 9-VOLT) No fair! I called dibs on Lucario!

9-VOLT: Nuh-uh! I saw him first!

MARIO: (getting up) What is going on here?

9-VOLT: (looks to MARIO and smiles in embarrassment) Oh, sorry, Mario. Bowser Jr and I were trying to capture Lucario.

MARIO: (shocked) Why were you trying to capture him?

BOWSER JR: Duh! That’s how you play Pokemon! Don’t you know anything, chump?

MARIO: (eyes wide open) Pokemon?! What the-how are- (grunts in frusteration) Can’t you-a go play somewhere else? You-are breaking windows!

BOWSER JR: (points to LUCARIO) Blame him. He’s the one who led us here in the first place.

LUCARIO: Because I was trying to get away from you! Besides, you can’t capture me! I already have a trainer.

9-VOLT: Yeah, but you’re in Smash, now. For example, Pikachu is usually owned by Ash, but since he’s an independent player, he’s free for capture. Same rule applies to you.

LUCARIO: (freaking out) Then why don’t you chase him instead?

BOWSER JR: We tried, but Samus already had dibs on him.

MARIO: Just get out of the-a dormitory!

BOWSER JR: (hands up in the air) Whoa, okay, chump. (To 9-VOLT) Come on, 9-Volt, let’s go find some other place to capture Pokemon. Someone where NO ONE will complain! (He and 9-VOLT leaves)

MARIO: (sitting back down on his chair) Mamma mia! What’s up with those kids?

LUCARIO: Tell me about it. (Rests on the arm of the chair) Maybe it’s all that March Madness stuff going to their heads.

MARIO: Or because of the warm weather.

(Suddenly, the ground started to shake, stumbling the two of them. After that, the sound of an engine is heard.)

LUCARIO: (alert) What is going on here?

MARIO: (horrified) I know that sound…

(He and LUCARIO take a look outside, where they see the Odyssey rising up from the ground. Along with it were 9-VOLT and BOWSER JR, whooping out in good fun.)

BOWSER JR: New Donk City or bust!

MARIO: (freaking out) How did they get control of that ship?!

(LUCARIO passes out. The Odyssey makes its departure, and the scene zooms way far into New Donk City, where there are kids getting into a new fad on Pokemon. There, it shows a view of children dressed up in various ways. In a building, there is KIRBY, dressed as a businesswoman, walking with a suitcase and a handful of pokeballs.)

KIRBY: I’m not only certified to do taxes, but I’m certified to do Pokemon Battles!

(Scene changes to where POPO and NANA are at, walking their Pichus on the sidewalk while checking their “Pokedexes”.)

POPO: Even though we are two…

NANA: We fight as one!

BOTH PICHUS: Pichu!

(Scene changes to the outside of City Hall, where WENDY was dressed fabulously for an occasion. By her side is Gardevoir, standing tall.)

WENDY: Having a connection with pokemon is the most fabulous approach!

(Scene changes to a shabby-made lab in the town center. There, PENNY is arranging her tools and textbooks while Eevee scurries around, making a big mess everywhere she goes.)

PENNY: Nobody said science was a clean job! (Ducks when Eevee knocks down some things from the table) The same goes with pokemon battles!

(Scene changes to the landing spot of the Odyssey for New Donk City, where it makes its landing. BOWSER JR and 9-VOLT hopped out from it.)

BOWSER JR: In the city, anything is possible. (Nudges 9-VOLT) Come on! Let’s go Pokemon training!

9-VOLT: (excited, jumping up) Yeah!

(Both exit the landing area. Off to the side was a mysterious figure in disguise. He faces towards the camera.)

MYSTERIOUS FIGURE: In case you’re confused, ever since the announcements of Pokemon Sword and Shield plus the Detective Pikachu movie, all the kids are hyped up, developing the lifestyle of pokemon trainers. 9-Volt and Bowser Jr want to be the very best. Well, (takes out pokeball, sneaky smile) let’s see…if they can try to beat me first! (Stage fades into black while an evil laugh emerges.)

(Who was that mysterious figure so determined to knock Bowser Jr and 9-Volt off of their goals? Find out when the story continues!)

LUCARIO: Oh, so now it’s a pokemon show based off Sm5sh? Come on, man!
